results:
Based on the search results, here are the key details about Dune's publication history involving Chilton Books and Sterling Lanier:

## Rejection by Publishers
Over twenty different publishing houses initially rejected Dune, with more than twenty other publishing companies having already turned the book down before Chilton accepted it.

## Sterling Lanier and Chilton Books
Sterling E. Lanier was an editor for Chilton Books, a nonfiction publishing house known for their manuals on auto-repair. When Frank Herbert got a publishing deal, it was because the editor Sterling E. Lanier searched Herbert out after falling in love with the story he read in Analog magazine.

Originally published in serial form in Analog magazine, it was later accepted by Sterling Lanier at Chilton, a publisher of auto repair manuals, and released in August 1965. Chilton published the celebrated science fiction novel Dune by Frank Herbert in 1965.

## The Company's Background
Chilton Company (also known as Chilton Printing Co., Chilton Publishing Co., Chilton Book Co. and Chilton Research Services) is an American former publishing company, most famous for its trade magazines, and automotive manuals. Chilton had been best known as a publisher of automotive repair manuals and magazines for, by then, nearly 70 years.

## Publication Details and Consequences
The offer was accepted, and a few months later, in 1965, the auto repair company published its first fiction novel, Dune. Chilton priced the 412-page novel at a whopping $5.95, which is over $56 today. On top of this, they printed a mere 2,200 copies for the first edition.

Dune sold slowly — so slowly, in fact, that Chilton editor Sterling Lanier was fired over the decision to publish it after the first year of publication due to high costs and poor initial sales.

## Herbert's Humorous Take
According to his son Brian, Frank Herbert would sometimes crack that Chilton may change the title to How to Repair Your Ornithopter, referencing the transport vessels in the Dune universe and making light of the publisher's automotive repair manual background.
